intro: Cithareloma registanicum, commonly known as the Registan cithareloma, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand extreme temperatures and limited water availability. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in a fine layer of hair, helping to reduce water loss in its harsh environment. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native range.
